items.label: 1982 New Orleans Jazz & Heritage Festival
items.SessionNotes: Shots of the Zulus, Big Jumpers, Young Men's Olympians, Dirty Dozen Brass Band and assorted Jazz Fest attendees.  Dirty Dozen members: "Brother" Charles Joseph: trombone; Ephram Towns: trumpet; Benny Jones: bass drum; Kurt Joseph: tuba; Roger Lewis: barit

items.label: Maple Leaf Bar
items.SessionNotes: Traditional New Orleans jazz played by the house band of the Maple Leaf Bar and interviews with band members. Paul Crawford, trombone; Jeff Riddick, piano and vocal; Raymond Burke, clarinet; Raphael Benitez, bass; Jack Bachman, trumpet; Butch Massico, dru

items.id: Funeral parade for Marshall Poland, Sr.
items.label: Funeral parade for Marshall Poland, Sr.
items.SessionName: Funeral parade for Marshall Poland, Sr.
items.SessionNotes: Funeral parade for Marshall Poland, Sr., led by Grand Marshall Gloria Irving and the Dirty Dozen Brass Band. After parade, shots of band in Armstrong Park. Dirty Dozen members: "Brother" Charles Joseph: trombone; Ephram Towns: trumpet; Benny Jones: bass d

items.label: Armstrong Park
items.SessionNotes: Dirty Dozen Brass Band performance (May 15) and interviews with Greg Davis & Roger Lewis of the band (May 16) in Armstrong Park. Dirty Dozen members: "Brother" Charles Joseph: trombone; Ephram Towns: trumpet; Benny Jones: bass drum; Kurt Joseph: tuba; Rog

items.label: Treme Interviews
items.SessionNotes: Interview with Iona Raybon and Beatrice Austin in the Treme neighborhood.

items.label: 66th Annual Zulu Parade
items.SessionNotes: The 66th Annual Zulu Parade with Himas "Flo" Anckle and his Majestic Brass Band, featuring, among others, Nathaniel Gray and Lawrence Trotter.

items.id: Dirty Dozen Brass Band at the Glass House
items.label: Dirty Dozen Brass Band at the Glass House
items.SessionName: Dirty Dozen Brass Band at the Glass House
items.SessionNotes: The Dirty Dozen Brass Band at the Glass House, interspersed with Lomax's interviews with clientele. Dirty Dozen members: "Brother" Charles Joseph: trombone; Ephram Towns: trumpet; Benny Jones: bass drum; Kurt Joseph: tuba; Roger Lewis: baritone sax; Kevin

items.label: Raul Bertuccelli's float workshop
items.SessionNotes: Shots of and interview with Raul Bertuccelli in his Mardi Gras float workshop.

items.id: Big Chief Jake and Witch Doctor Bird
items.label: Big Chief Jake and Witch Doctor Bird
items.SessionName: Big Chief Jake and Witch Doctor Bird
items.SessionNotes: Footage of Witch Doctor Bird and his Mardi Gras Indian costumes; interviews with Bird and Big Chief Jake Millon.

items.label: White Eagles at Darrell's Lounge
items.SessionNotes: White Eagles rehearsal at Darrell’s Lounge with Big Chief Jake Millon, Indian drum ensemble, and spyboy dancers.

items.label: Preservation Hall
items.SessionNotes: Kid Thomas Valentine's band performs at Preservation Hall. Drums: Alonzo Stewart; Trombone: Worthia Thomas; Bass: Chester Zardis; Piano: Sing Miller; Banjo: Emanuel Sayles; Sax: Emmanuel Paul; Clarinet: Willie Humphrey; Trumpet: Kid Thomas Valentine. Also

items.label: Tulane Jazz Colloquium
items.SessionNotes: Performance by Bill Russell’s John Robicheaux Orchestra at Tulane's Jazz Colloquium. Bill Russell, violin; Lionel Ferbos, trumpet; John Robicheaux, drums; Frank Fields, bass; Morton Larson, piano; Glen Wilson, clarinet; Paul Crawford, trombone.

items.label: White Eagles Indian Parade
items.SessionNotes: Short clips of a parade with Big Chief Jake Millon and his White Eagles Indians.

items.label: New Orleans Jazz Reunion
items.SessionNotes: A "New Orleans Jazz Reunion" jam session, with spotty sound and remarks by Danny Barker, Al Rose, and Richard Allen. Posthumous award ceremony MC’d by Janette Kimball. Band includes Jeff Riddick, Lester Alexis, Danny Barker, Jimmy LaRocca, Edward Franks,

items.label: Mother-In-Law Lounge
items.SessionNotes: Ernie K-Doe and band at K-Doe's Mother-In-Law Lounge. Sound intermittent.

items.label: New Orleans landscapes
items.SessionNotes: Various landscape and incidental shots, many without sounds (MOS).

items.label: Jack Owens & Bud Spires
items.SessionNotes: 02.01.01 through 02.01.27 shot Aug. 12; the remaining on Aug. 14. Unless otherwise noted, all tracks feature Jack Owens on vocal and guitar and Bud Spires on harmonica.
items.Setting: At the farm of Jack Owens

items.id: Worship service at St. James Baptist Church
items.label: Worship service at St. James Baptist Church
items.SessionName: Worship service at St. James Baptist Church
items.SessionNotes: All tracks include vocals by the congregation of St. James Missionary Baptist Church in addition to lead vocalists as noted.

items.label: Sensational Friendly Brothers & Heavenly Singers
items.SessionNotes: The Sensational Friendly Brothers and the Heavenly Gospel Singers perform at St. James Missionary Baptist Church. The former, from Tallulah, Louisiana, feature drums, electric guitar, and bass; the latter are an a cappella group.

items.label: Sam Chatmon
items.SessionNotes: All performances feature Sam Chatmon on vocal and guitar.

items.label: Prison work-songs
items.SessionNotes: Re-enactments of prison worksongs by Walter Brown, Joe Savage, and friends. All performances by Walter Brown, Joe Savage, unidentified men, hoe & vocal.

items.label: Otha Turner
items.SessionNotes: All performances consist of Otha Turner on fife (and vocal where noted); G.D. Young, bass drum; E.P. Burton, snare; Eddie Ware, snare.

items.label: Como fife & drum picnic
items.SessionNotes: Performances of Napolian [sic] Strickland and the Como Drum Corps at a picnic hosted by David (last name indecipherable). All performances Napolian Strickland, fife (and harmonica, where noted); Como Drum Corps (members unidentified), bass and snare drums

items.label: A.M.E. gospel quartets
items.SessionNotes: Mostly fragmentary performances with intermittent camera.
items.Setting: Gospel quartets at an unidentified A.M.E. church

items.label: Lucius Smith
items.SessionNotes: All performances feature Lucius Smith, vocal and banjo.
items.Setting: At the home of Lucius Smith

items.label: Track-lining reenactment
items.SessionNotes: Retired railroad crew workers re-enact a track-lining, with song.

items.label: Levee camp workers and roustabouts
items.SessionNotes: Another session with Walter Brown and Joe Savage, discussing both their levee camp work and their time as roustabouts on the Mississippi River. They are joined by a man named Arthur, whose last name was not recorded.
